staging.description: Browser / Web Testing. Allows Debug Controls for testing.
staging.note: Used for 'Web Version' testing outside Telegram.

issues.title: Missing Bootcamp Mode
issues.description: The game allows new users to enter the Squad Vault directly without the GDD-mandated 'Bootcamp' (Solo Onboarding) mode. Code contains stubbed references but no implementation.

issues.title: Deployment Target Mismatch
issues.description: Deployment targeted 'cipher-squad-client' instead of the production 'cipher-squad-web', causing new features to be missing on the live URL.

issues.title: Runtime Error: require is not defined
issues.description: Uncaught ReferenceError: require is not defined in GameState.js (initBootcamp). Likely caused by CommonJS require() usage in Vite (ESM) environment.

issues.title: Bootcamp UI/Logic Malfunction
issues.description: Multiple Issues: 1) Duplicated Debug Controls. 2) Grid shows 9 tiles (3x3) instead of 4 (2x2). 3) Interaction blocked (OPEN does nothing). 4) State race condition on load (Server data overwrites local bootcamp config).

issues.title: Bootcamp State Exit Failure
issues.description: Exiting a tile detail view (clearSelection) or encountering an error forcefully transitions state to VAULT_ACTIVE, incorrectly exiting BOOTCAMP mode. This causes VaultGrid to render Bootcamp tiles (layout breakage) and API calls to fail (bypass skipped).

issues.title: Master Image Preview Failure
issues.description: Clicking 'SHOW MASTER IMAGE' in Debug Controls displays a black square instead of the puzzle solution image. This suggests the image source is missing, invalid, or not defined for the current logic.

issues.title: Misleading Debug Text & Nonogram Query
issues.description: Debug Controls incorrectly state '*Reseed will generate new 15x15 Space Invader Pattern' while in Bootcamp Mode (which is static). User also questions if Nonogram generation is functional.

issues.title: Stuck in Bootcamp / Nonograms Inaccessible
issues.description: User reports Nonograms 'don't work at all' and Master Image doesn't show expected 'Space Invader'. Analysis suggests User is stuck in Bootcamp (static 2x2) because Graduation state is not persisted or handled, correctly preventing access to Main Game generative content.

issues.title: Bootcamp Tiles Missing Puzzle Data
issues.description: Opening a provided Bootcamp tile (e.g., b_0_0) results in 'Tile Data: undefined' and 'Missing solutionGrid' warnings. This causes the puzzle view to use a fallback mock instead of a real solvable puzzle, blocking progression.

issues.title: Bootcamp Visual Reward Mismatch
issues.description: User reports disappointment that Bootcamp completion yields no 'Image' and the Master Preview shows numbers instead of Art. The current 2x2 grid does not form a cohesive picture, violating the core game promise of 'solving to reveal an image'.

issues.title: Bootcamp Completion Missing Master Image
issues.description: After solving all Bootcamp tiles, the 'Training Complete' screen appears but does not display the assembled 'Heart' Master Image. User expects to see the final reward before entering the lobby.

issues.title: Main Game Regression: Missing Puzzle Data & Master Image
issues.description: After graduating Bootcamp, Main Game tiles show '?' in Master Preview and Nonograms are non-functional. Caused by 1) GameControls regression defaulting to '?' and 2) Likely missing `solutionGrid` data in the Main Game mock/fetch generation logic.

issues.title: Main Game Completion Missing Win Screen
issues.description: Upon solving all 9 tiles in the Main Vault, the system transitions to 'VAULT_COMPLETE' (visible in status header), but the UI remains static. No 'Vault Unlocked' modal or Master Image reveal is displayed.

issues.title: Crash on Vault Load: tiles is not defined
issues.description: User reports specific ReferenceError in console. Cause identified: The `tiles` state declaration was accidentally removed during the previous edit to `VaultGrid.jsx`, causing a crash whenever `tiles` is accessed.

issues.title: Completion Modal Loop
issues.description: After closing the 'Vault Decrypted' modal, it immediately reappears (or reappears on reload). The current 'Close' action triggers a page reload, which re-evaluates the Vault State as 'COMPLETE', acting as if it's a new completion event.

issues.title: Force Reseed Fails to Reset State
issues.description: User reports that clicking 'FORCE RESEED' or 'RELOAD APP' does not reset the 'Solved' status of tiles. Tiles remain solved even after an admin reseed which should wipe the vault.

issues.title: Force Reseed API Failure
issues.description: User encounters 'Seed Failed' alert. This likely indicates that the Backend Worker is either not deployed or returning an error (e.g. 404 Not Found) for the '/admin/seed' endpoint.

issues.title: Force Reseed 401 Unauthorized
issues.description: User reports 'Seed Failed' and console shows 401 Unauthorized on '/api/game/vault/admin/seed'. This implies the Worker has an ADMIN_KEY set that does not match the 'dev-key-ignore-for-now' sent by the frontend.

issues.title: Persistent 401 on Force Reseed
issues.description: Despite explicitly allowing the dev key in the Worker code, the user still receives 401 Unauthorized. This suggests the deployment might not have propagated, or there is a subtle issue with header case-sensitivity or environment variable handling in the Worker.

issues.title: Persistent 401 on Reseed (3rd Attempt)
issues.description: The 401 error persists. My hardcoded check failed. Possibilities: Header stripping by Cloudflare/Proxy, Case-sensitivity mismatch (though fetch normalizes), or I am editing the wrong file/deploying to wrong target. I need to debug by echoing the received key.

issues.title: Frontend Swallows API Error Details
issues.description: The Frontend 'GameControls.jsx' throws 'res.statusText' logic, masking the custom error body from the worker. This prevents the user from seeing the 'Received Key' debug info necessary to solve BUG-020/BUG-019.

issues.title: Admin Endpoint Blocked by User Auth
issues.description: The '/admin/seed' endpoint is unreachable because the Worker enforces user authentication (checking 'userId') BEFORE checking for the Admin Route. Since the Admin request only sends an Admin Key and no User Auth, it falls into the generic 401 trap.

issues.title: Master Image Pattern Mismatch
issues.description: The 'Force Reseed' function generates a simple box pattern instead of the expected 'Space Invader' pattern described in the UI. The debug image shows a generic X shape with a box, which lacks the visual complexity and 'alien' feel required.

issues.title: Production Build Failure (MIME Type)
issues.description: Production URL loads 'client.jsx' directly as text/jsx, causing browser error. Indicates incorrect deployment of source files instead of built assets (Missing Build Step).

issues.title: Leaderboard Crash (ReferenceError: useState)
issues.description: Clicking 'VIEW LEADERBOARD' crashes the app with 'useState is not defined'. Likely caused by missing React import in Leaderboard.jsx after recent refactoring.

issues.title: Leaderboard Render Crash (t.map is not a function)
issues.description: Leaderboard crashes with TypeError: map is not a function. Indicates 'scores' state is not an array. API response might be malformed or incorrectly parsed in TileActions/Leaderboard.

issues.title: Auto-Solve Crash (undefined grid)
issues.description: Clicking 'Auto Solve' crashes with TypeError reading 'filter'. Fixed by accessing gameState.vault.getTiles() instead of invalid .grid property.

issues.title: Auto-Solve Crash (TILE_STATUS not defined)
issues.description: ReferenceError: TILE_STATUS is not defined. Fixed by restoring import statement in GameControls.jsx.

issues.title: Tile Lock Soft-Lock (Puzzle doesn't open)
issues.description: Fixed by implementing Observer pattern in GameState to ensure reactive UI updates when selecting tiles. Added cursor:pointer to owned locks.

issues.title: Telegram WebApp Stale Version
issues.description: Bumped version to v1.1.2 to force visual differentiation and encourage cache invalidation.

issues.title: Telegram Bot Environment Mismatch
issues.description: Bot was configured for 'qa' branch of 'cipher-squad-web'. Deployed v1.1.2 to 'qa' branch to resolve.

issues.title: Nonogram Mobile Usability (Too Small)
issues.description: Adjusted PuzzleGrid to use CSS Variables. Added responsive media query for mobile (32px cells, full width modal).

issues.title: Debug Controls Visible to All
issues.description: Restricted debug controls to Admin (69069618) or Non-Telegram environments.
